Reviews.Title: “Great Deal!”
Reviews.Author: Roadie4750
Reviews.Content: We often visit Napa and this hotel has become our favorite. We have stayed at both v. inexpensive motels and the Hilton. The Hawthorn had everything we needed to make our trip comfortable: mini-frig, microwave, free wi-fi, pool, jacuzzi, fitness rm, breakfast, and an efficient, pleasant staff. The room, though a bit dated, was roomy and v. clean. Because of the good price, we were able to extend our stay and we will continue to book in Hawthorn Suites when we visit Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Best for the Price!”
Reviews.Author: TightTraveler
Reviews.Content: We arrived to find a very roomy studio with a King bed and a sofa, mini fridge and microwave. It was impeccably clean, and suited our needs very well. Yes, there is an old school CRT television, yes, the decor is a bit dated (think 8 to 10 years) and yes, the location is in the auto dealer's section of the town. But then again, HOW MUCH DID YOU PAY FOR YOUR ACCOMMODATIONS? Here's what else you'll also find...a very clean and well kept indoor pool and spa area, a full hot breakfast with sausage links or bacon, scrambled eggs, and hashbrowns, a very pleasant and helpful staff, and nicely landscaped flower beds surrounding the property. We couldn't have been happier, unless we were willing to fork out a hundred dollars MORE for a room!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Room was very clean and comfortable. The breakfast buffet was great and the staff even made more bacon as it was already gone when we got to the dining area for breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Great Base Point”
Reviews.Author: cardinaljumps
Reviews.Content: We spent Four nights here while Wine tasting and site seeing in Napa Valley and Sonoma Country. Great for doing both counties. The rooms all had exterior entrances which was OK but the rooms made up for that, breakfast was alright, it could be a bit crowded at times, There is all kind of dinning in the area for the evenings. All in all we enjoyed it very much, rooms were very clean....... nice pool area also....

Reviews.Title: “poor customer service-no tv-outdated”
Reviews.Author: luis z
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel for 1 night, they have old fashion CRT TV'S with very poor picture quality. Chanels were all dark, clerk although polite could not help. He checked all other rooms and personally found the picture to be also bad. Carpet was filthy, and even though the employees were nice, their manager Huliani was condescending and made me wait for along time while she took calls in her office. would not recommend this hotel, pay $20 more and stay someplace else

Reviews.Title: “Above average place to stay”
Reviews.Author: vinominnesota
Reviews.Content: This was an affordable and nice enough place to stay for a couple nights in wine country. Located on a noisy street, the street noise was not an issue. The walls of the rooms must be fairly thin, though, because we could hear people talking in the room next to us. The free breakfast was a plus (baked goods, eggs, bacon or sausage, cereals, yogurt, fruit, juices, coffee). The pool area looked nice, although we did not have time to use it. My only slight complaint was a mild mold or mildew smell in the bathroom. I thought about asking to be moved to a different room, because the staff seemed friendly and helpful, but decided to just put up with it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: judahvista
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night during the week after a day of wine tasting. I booked online for $101 total. The hotel is really a motel on a busy street but as it does not face the street, the noise was minimal, especially if you're in one of the last rooms of the building. Parking was easy and there is easy access to many stores, including Target. The front desk was very helpful when I could not get my wi-fi to work in the room. The room was clean and there was plenty of lighting. I like that there was packets of toothpaste that I could use. I'm sorry to say that even though the indoor pool looked inviting, I did not use it. The only issue I had was not having enough seating at breakfast and having the food run out quickly (especially the bacon). The food was replaced, but not quickly enough. When I eventually went back to grab some coffee after checking out, I noticed that there was left over food, so running out of food was not the issue, just that the food was not cooked fast enough. Overall, I really enjoyed my stay and it was a great value

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Jim N
Reviews.Content: A very warm greeting from staff to start our stay. The area is convienient to get to Downtown Napa. The rooms were spacious and comfortable and most of all clean. The hot breakfast in the morning is such a plus. I would highly recomend staying here to anyone. A heartfelt thankyou to all the staff for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding staff”
Reviews.Author: Anna101101
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff were frendly, helpful and very accommodating, I asked if we could be put in the back and away from the road, ice and vending machines and they did not care that we were paying a goverment rate unlike radisson fishermans wharf where they put us by all of these just because we were paying a little less. Hawthorn's staff did't hesitate to accommodate my request. I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, served it's purpose”
Reviews.Author: mccafjohn
Reviews.Content: We were attending a photography workshop for 4 days and just needed a place to stay at for the evenings. Paid $650 through Priceline saving about $50-60 for the 4 night stay. Location was not important but there are a couple of car dealerships and broken down buildings close by. A peeve would be it's hard to see the sign and the bushes need to be cut back. Close to the supermarket, 5 minutes to old town Napa, ate the breakfast 2 times. Biscuts & gravy, sausage one morning and the next morning the choice was bacon and potatos. The eggs were a little rubbery. My wife ate fruit and cereal both mornings. Overall, excellent housekeeping, wi-fi, parkiing, front desk, i didn' notice any noise, coffee in room was a saver for me but the Hvac was hard to use because the instructions were worn off. Sleped with the window open (what a concept) for fresh air but the wife forbade it the next night when she found out. (she was afraid) I would definately stay again for this price. W-Sun Room#116.

Reviews.Title: “It was adequate”
Reviews.Author: Ann L
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and offered a full breakfast service. Unfortunately the first morning a very large family came in for breakfast and cleaned out the food, leaving none for the rest of us. The hotel was not prepared to restock so we had to go an separately purchase our breakfast. The air conditioning in our room did not work and we asked to get it serviced. They were very polite and checked it out and told us it was fine. Later that night we had to switch rooms because it was so hot, the air conditioning was not working. The first night we got very little sleep because of the room temperature. The staff was extremely nice and the place was well maintained, they just need to fix a few issues.

Reviews.Title: “Not at all what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: Tara G
Reviews.Content: I think the picture fooled me...it looked nothing like that. It was located on a busy 4 lane road next to a Ford Dealership and a vacant, rundown liquor store. They offer a hot buffet breakfast, but two out of the three meals we were there for they had run out of the scrambled eggs, bacon, and/or potatoes. We even waited 20 minutes one morning for them to refill the eggs before we gave up and went to McDonald's across the street. We thought we'd have a nice quiet hotel in the heart of Napa...we were disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: keithguitar
Reviews.Content: It was my wife and my 20th wedding anniversary - when my wife told them not only did they congratulate us they upgraded our room at no additional charge - the staff we extremely courteous and friendly - the room was very spacious and clean - the stay was great. The next time we go to the Napa area we are going to stay there again. I would highly recommend staying at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pastaluver14
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at this place.The room itself was clean and decent.The staff was nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE! THIS IS NOT 3 STAR HOTEL - IT'S A MOTEL 6â€Ž”
Reviews.Author: janinek25
Reviews.Content: If you are used to staying in 3-4 star hotels AVOID THIS PLACE LIKE THE PLAGUE! It was a motel-6 that was "fixed up" with nicer furniture. The staff could care less about you and was totally rude! We like to travel up to Napa and I will never stay here again! The only good things I can say is that the bed was comfortable and the location is pretty convenient. Too bad there were creeking type noises in the ceiling (we were on the first floor - room 105) that never stopped all night and kept us up. When the front desk was approached about it they basically said, "Too bad so sad for you". This was our first night in Napa and we were so tired it ruined day 2 in Napa and threw our enitre trip off to a bad start.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Would be perfect if closer to town”
Reviews.Author: Spanner101
Reviews.Content: Hawthorn Suites was a nice hotel. The staff were really helpful and gave us some good advice. They were prepared to make bookings for us and we even got some free wine tasting vouchers for a Vinyard in the area which was a really fun aftrenoon. The only negative I have about the hotel is that it is about a mile out of Down Town. It only takes about 20-30 minutes to walk but it's not the nicest of roads I would recomend getting a taxi. All in all good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Is ALWAYS Wrong!”
Reviews.Author: hotelofhorrors
Reviews.Content: According to management and staff, the customer is always wrong. In my 25 years of business travel, I have never encountered such unprofessional hospitality workers. This corporation needs to clean house. As you can see by the "scabies" review, hotel was defensive vs. apologetic. The staff made me feel like dirt, Totally humiliated.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the only negative”
Reviews.Author: shario
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights recently. Usually we stay at nicer places in Napa in the off season, but summer rates are so expensive that we decided to give the Hawthorn Inn a try. Initially I was pretty distressed because the neighborhood is even more industrial than I remembered (mainly car dealerships and auto parts stores) and I was wishing we had sprung for a nicer hotel. But once we checked in and saw the room, we were fine. The front desk staff is extremely nice and eager to help. The rooms are much larger than the average hotel and include a microwave and mini-refrigerator, which really came in handy. A five minute drive will take you to the center of Napa. Our only concern was we didn't want to drive at all after drinking and there was nowhere within walking distance (aside from taco trucks and one diner) to eat. So my husband had to limit himself to one glass of wine with dinner. If you drink a lot, this will be an issue unless you have a designated driver or take cabs. The free breakfast was a nice touch and saved us some money. All in all, it isn't ideal but if the choice is to stay at the Hawthorn Inn or not go in summer because of high hotel rates, it's definitely worth staying here. Please don't get excited about the gym, it consists of two machines. It's better to get a day pass for the gym in Napa if you want to work out. The hotel can help you with this.

Reviews.Title: “A nice palce to stay at reasonable rates”
Reviews.Author: ven9
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for four nights. I traveled there to attend a family function and buy a car to one of family members who live in CA. The rooms are neat. Beds and pillows are good. Towels and other toiletries are not so great. I really enjoyed the hot breakfast. The staff is nice and customer friendly. Luckily I found a Honda Dealer next door and bought new Honda car there. I visited three more shops but this guy gave me a good deal. Cons: The out side view is not good and there is an old building, the steps are from outside and I did not feel comfortable but there were problems during the night. There is highway in front of the hotel and you hear traffic noise.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy Swimming Pool”
Reviews.Author: ruerue189
Reviews.Content: The swimming pool was disgusting. It had floating hair & other dirt collected in what looked like an oil slick. The bottom of the pool had brown dirt collected on the bottom. This was on a weekend in the middle of day. It did not appear they had the pump on. For $200.00 per night you would think they could clean the pool. I was afraid to swim in it. The towels in the room were worn & felt like sand paper. They only left 1 towel per guest. I will never stay in this dump again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!! Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: AmyEast
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose the Hawthorne Inn and Suites for our Napa vacation and were thoroughly impressed. The room was extremely clean, updated and had several amenities which were above and beyond our expectations. The room had a fridge and microwave which came in handy. The hotel served a hot breakfast which consisted of eggs, potatoes, bacon/sausage, bagels, toast, fruit, yogurt, cereal, tea, coffee, hot chocolate....a great way to fill up for a day out wine tasting and exploring Napa Valley. The breakfast room had a stone fireplace and wine bottles adding to the napa feel. Free internet, wine tasting coupons and brochures added to the wow factor for the price and location of this hotel. I was hesitant based on the star rating and price but couldn't have been more wrong. We will be back in a heartbeat!!! Do not hesitate to book this hotel, you won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Great Service, more money for wine”
Reviews.Author: ChalkmanSf
Reviews.Content: My company was having an event at the Carneros Inn which was more than 3X the price of the Hawthorne Inn. The Marriott and the Westin were 2X. The Hawthorne Inn was clean, the room was big, the staff were great, internet was free, the breakfast was good, there was HBO, and I could walk from downtown Napa. What's not to like? The owner, Anil, went so far as to give me a ride when I was struggling to get a cab to take me a couple of miles. I'd stay here again in a heart beat, and buy 3 more bottles of wine with the money I save!

Reviews.Title: “Don't go. Got scabies from the room.”
Reviews.Author: LafayetteCASrg
Reviews.Content: What else can I say? Slept in the room (one night) by myself, developed scabies 4 days later. Kid and wife did not have or get them. Thankfully got rid of it with treatment. Parent company sent an email shifting blame to the local franchisee, the local franchisee at least looked into the matter-though denied I could have contracted it from their place. Buyer beware, you may get more than you bargained for with a stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Minutes From Downtown Napa”
Reviews.Author: GQ_Trippin
Reviews.Content: HOTEL. An affordable weekend getaway. Save the money for the wineâ€”youâ€™ll do plenty. STAFF. Accommodating and pleasant. ROOM. Surprisingly larger than expected with small living area with couch and desk. LOCATION. Conveniently located on main road and minutes from the Downtown areaâ€”across the bridge. ATTRACTION. Most wineries are just a short drive away. TIP(S). Our favorite is V. Sattui. Bring a sheet/ blanket and enjoy a picnic outside.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to the Wyndham standards”
Reviews.Author: lexiloo78
Reviews.Content: There are not many hotels in Napa that will allow a 1 night stay during the summer - but this is one of them. With that said, I would not stay here again. I was surprised to see a property with doors facing out. One 1 side is a car dealership - on the other a side an empty auto body shop....not such a nice view. After using the tub sitting inthe middle of the room, the water pipes dripped in the walls all night long. I was unable to get the room to cool and once the fan turned off, you could here road noise all night long. I complained at check and the price of the room was reduced to the non-jacuzzi room price , but as far as the rest of the issues - he said I would have to contact the manager.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok...not great”
Reviews.Author: toddkddot
Reviews.Content: An ok place to stay. I booked a room with a jacuzzi but the jacuzzi did not work. at first they said they would move us to a new room and were on their way to drop of the keys but then called and said that room was already rented so we were stuck. they did reduce our rate to the same as a room without a jacuzzi. the hot breakfast was better than I had expected; eggs, potatoes, bacon, coffee, cereal, fruit, muffins, juice. the room was clean, no frills. much cheaper than some of the other places in Napa. If I had to do it again, I would probably consider John Muir.

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: awright517
Reviews.Content: Your average budget accommodations. I don't particularly like staying at hotels where the entrance to the rooms is on the outside of the bldg. but I was only here for one night. Lovely breakfast buffet incld. in price which is an added bonus. Beds not comfortable, but sleepable. Incld. small fridge, tiny bathroom with toilet and shower and vanity/sink on the outside of bathroom. Carpets need replacing as they are worn. All in all okay for someone not requiring anything luxurious or long term.

Reviews.Title: “Ok place”
Reviews.Author: TravelingG123
Reviews.Content: We needed a place in Napa/Sonoma where we could spend a Saturday night. Most of the B&B's we looked at had two-night minimums, so even though we were prepared to spend more than the Hawthorn costs, we weren't able to. We called Inn at Sonoma and were referred to a phone number, I think called StaySonoma, where supposedly they had access to which hotels had short-notice rooms available. We took the Hawthorn because it was in a decent location (we had a car available) and was $189 (about $205 total = high taxes). The Hawthorn was acceptable. Room was clean. Bathroom was acceptable, but not great. Service guy was friendly and referred us to a fantastic vegetarian restaurant (Ubuntu) which we much appreciated. The hotel room entrances are on the outside of the building. Ours faced the parking lot. I would have preferred a hotel with doors inside the building, but didn't realize this in time before we booked. Not exactly my idea of how one should enjoy themselves in wine country, but we managed to spend the money we saved on our room -- and spent it on wine and great food. Copia and Oxbow are both great places to stop.

Reviews.Title: “Great Amenities but bed too hard”
Reviews.Author: applejanna
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed 5 nights at this property and were pleased with everything except the beds. They were some of the hardest beds we have every encountered in a hotel. I don't just mean firm, I mean HARD. We have stayed in a lot of hotels and my husband travels for business, so we have a lot to compare in our minds. We are not fans of a soft bed either, but we felt these beds were way off the mark. We did not sleep well the whole trip, woke up with sore backs and hips. Not having good sleep certainly does affect a vacation. I asked the office if they had a foam topper we could use to make it more bareable but that was not available. If you like a really, really firm (hard) bed, you will not have a problem. If you like a comfortable nights rest in a reasonable bed you may want to consider another property. I was so disappointed that I am going to write to Hyatt and tell them I expected more from a well established hospitality company. Other than the beds, the hotel was great. The extensive complementary breakfast each morning was my favorite part. Not just cereal and toast, but also egg, potatoes, and breakfast meat. Real OJ or apple juice, muffins, toast, bagels, etc, etc... It was so nice! The room size was comfortable too, and we appreciated having a fridge and microwave. The free wireless interenet reception was not consistent and my husband had to acquire an ethernet cable from the front desk. Nonetheless, the internet was free. The bathroom was good too with the toilet and shower in a separate room from the sink and counter. I always like that. A real closet with plenty of space too and a couch (with reading lamp), coffee table and desk. Located right on the Silverado Trail just minutes from COPIA (a must see at beginning of your wine trip!) and very close to downtown Napa, just across the river. The price was reasonable for high season and if it weren't for the uncomfortable beds I would return again to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean place in efficient, ugly location”
Reviews.Author: finickytripper
Reviews.Content: The Good: Clean, newer, well-lit rooms with most of the typical amenities for motels in this price range, plus a microwave and mini-fridge. Decent hot and cold breakfast buffet in a clean, inviting public dining area. Helpful staff offered to print directions, was efficient, and was responsive to minor issues such as key cards and a blow dryer that each stopped working. Location was relatively convenient to major routes to the wineries; closest to the Carneros region and the southern Napa wineries. Target and grocery shopping was a quick hop away. Those with Hyatt points can stay here very inexpensively, especially relative to other accommodations during the high season. Adequate close parking. The Bad: As others have noted, the location is loaded with eyesores, from the adjacent abandoned liquor store to the brightly lit car lots across the street and adjacent. I also agree that the beds could be more comfortable. Our room near the front of the building bore the full brunt of noises all night from the busy road; I couldn't have slept without earplugs, but perhaps rooms further from the street are quieter. The front desk gave very poor customer service regarding a significant reservation mistake they made; other encounters were polite, but not friendly. Those who have stayed in a Hawthorn suite will miss the large kitchen area in the Inn. Overall, a decent value if you're a sound sleeper not looking for a particularly romantic Napa getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in the wine country”
Reviews.Author: momonthegoe
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 2-night stay in Napa at the Hawthorn. There were five couples and we knew we would be out visiting wineries most of the day and out at dinner in the evenings. We didn't want to spend a lot on accomodations, yet wanted something appealing. The Hawthorn fit the bill. It is immaculate, quiet and the location quite convenient. The daily breakfast was convenient. We would all stay there again. The only complaint is that the beds were a little hard. We booked a bus and driver through Pure Luxury Tours and were very pleased with their service.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this Place!! Unbelievably lame”
Reviews.Author: WORLD_TRAVEL777
Reviews.Content: We were booked in, to this hotel, for two days (signed contract, at front desk, upon check in) and planned to leave on the third morning. We were in Napa for a friends wedding. On the first night, after checking in, there was a lot of noise in the parking lot outside our room. Come to find out, there was a group of about 30 high school aged kids drinking alcohol in the parking lot & playing loud music from their cars. HAWTHORN SUITES STAFF APPARENTLY DID NOTHING!!! After ~ 3am, & some earplugs, I finally fell asleep. We were running late the following morning, to get to the wedding, and consequently never said anything to the front desk. The following morning we went to the wedding and when we returned, that afternoon, our room key didn't work. I initially thought our key had been damaged, so I went to the front desk and got a new key made. Upon returning to our room, WE FOUND SOMEONE ELSE IN OUR ROOM!! AFTER ONLY ONE DAY, OF OUR TWO DAY STAY, THIS DUMP RENTED OUT OUR ROOM TO SOMEONE ELSE????? Our things were later found, in the maids' area & we were informed that there were no more rooms, of the type we'd paid for, and we could leave if we wanted to. The manager didn't seem to care at all. Luckily we were able to find much better accommodations, at a nicer location, nearby. DO YOURSELF A HUGE FAVOR AND AVOID THE HAWTHORN SUITES IN NAPA!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: daulton15
Reviews.Content: The hotel had basic rooms, no frills or thrills. The location was good because it was only a few minutes from downtown Napa and not too far from many wineries. The breakfast was also good. The best part of the hotel was the front desk's knowledge and friendliness. They were able to recommend great wineries and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “nice at first but bad experience in the end”
Reviews.Author: katiemill
Reviews.Content: My friends and I visited Napa Valley for a wedding. The staff at first was very friendly and offered us information about wineries in the area. However, the attitude changed when we arrived back at the hotel late at night/morning after the wedding. We were being very respectful, not being loud or anything that would disturb the other guests, we just wanted to go to bed. We arrived at our room and our key cards did not work in the lock on the door. After going back twice to retrieve new cards we had the staff member on duty come and look at the door. Nothing worked to open the door; he brought numerous keys and a machine. After about 45 minutes the staff member on duty called the manager but explained to us that he did not answer the phone and we asked him to call again but he gave us the number. One of the members of our group had to call the manager herself, and explain to him the problem. Finally after an hour of waiting with little apology our door was open. The next morning when we went to pay we asked for a discount on our room and the staff member that was now on duty was extremely rude. Was condescending to us calling us "girls" and telling us that we only had to wait an hour and it was very late at night we came in. After loosing sleep and being spoken to very rudely we were only given a $30 discount. We should not have to worry about getting in to our hotel room no matter what time it is or who we are. They had no regard that they had left 3 women stranded outside their hotel room. I was left with a sour taste in my mouth, and I have never written something like this but I feel that I was completely treated inappropriately. I would not recommend to anyone to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a Real Value and private Jacuzzi tub”
Reviews.Author: GelatoSF
Reviews.Content: This is a deal during high season like June. Our room with a Jacuzzi tub in the room (literally in the bedroom- you could see pics on their website) was $189 ($129 without the jacuzzi) when all of the other hotels were charging at least $250. The receptionists was also very helpful and courteous during the several calls we made asking about breakfast, the tub, quiet room, etc... And the room was quiet and very clean. There is hot breakfast, a basic one: eggs, sausage, potatoes, bread/bagel, good coffee, juice, cereal, hot chocolate, tea. Free internet access in your room. Fridge (excellent for storing your bottles of water or leftovers or refreezing your icepacks) , microwave, coffee maker, and hair dryer too. They also take Hyatt points here. With all that said, this is a basic hotel/motel, not a luxurious one and not a romantic one. There is no view. The location is in downtown Napa, so it's a short drive north to the wineries. During low season, I'll look for bargains at the B&Bs or romantic high end places, but during the summer, when most of the day is spent outside, and I just need a nice cool, quiet, and clean room with all the conveniences, the Hawthorne fits the bill. We also had our toddler with us, and she thought the Jacuzzi was one of the best part of the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice price”
Reviews.Author: DC_Mike
Reviews.Content: Stayed one Friday night, AAA rate of $159 - Double Queen, 3rd floor. Would stay here every time. Minutes from Copia and downtown. Free, warm breakfast was plentiful!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, pity about the outlook!”
Reviews.Author: SSThunder
Reviews.Content: We stayed a couple of nighst here in June of 2004, whlst on our honeymoon from Australia. We booked the Hawthorn through Expedia, and were amazed at the price. The place is not too old either. A great cooked brekkie in the morning in the dining room, and a great room. Indoor pool too! Pity about the outlook though! A view of a caravan sales place and the busy main road. Hardly a romantic vine area! Good value for the $'s though.

Reviews.Title: “big, clean rooms....awesome hot tub!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over Memorial Day weekend. The location isn't so great but it's safe and close to plenty of places to eat. We stayed there because it was close to the Wine Train. The rooms are spacious, clean and pretty basic with above average amenities (mini fridge, sink, nice toiletries). Prices are average for tghe area I think. We splurged and got the hot tub in our room which was sooooooo worth it! Small but nice indoor pool. Friendly service. They also have a good buffet breakfast that's free.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel - just ok location”
Reviews.Author: dparis
Reviews.Content: We had 2 rooms for a Friday night only which is hard to get in Napa. The hotel was new and very nice. The rooms are outside entrances but parking spaces are not directly at the door which is good. There is a nice small indoor pool and the hotel has an elevator. The breakfast was fairly good with several hot and cold dishes to chose from. No pancakes or waffles though. The location is in a business (car lots, repair shops) district but not too far from downtown. We found the rooms very quiet even though it is on a busy street. We enjoy our stay and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A confortable newer motel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is an above average motel. Large clean comfortable rooms with refrig, microwave and free wired high speed internet access. The free hot breakfast includes scrambled eggs, potatoes, and bacon/sausage plus some cold items; however it is buffet style and not cooked to order.

HotelInfo.Name: Hawthorn Suites by Wyndham Napa Valley
HotelInfo.Address: 314 Soscol Ave., Napa, CA 94559
